data.title: lineWidget UI
data.body: Is there a similar UI element to CodeMirror's [Inline Widget](http://codemirror.net/demo/widget.html) in Atom? I'm working on [a project](https://github.com/tmcw/rpl) that's heavily dependent on persistent inline notes with custom content, and would love to make it into a plugin for a more fully-fledged editor.

data.title: Indentation wiped out on paste
data.body:
Hi, I just checked out and built v0.150.0 and I'm seeing an issue where indentation is being broken on pasted lines regardless of the setting of Auto Indent,  Auto Indent On Paste, and Normalize Indent On Paste.  With all these settings off  it doesn't preserve the existing indentation of the copied rows, it strips all indentation from the first row then removes that same amount of whitespace from the indent on subsequent rows.

Additionally if I turn on Auto Indent On Paste it moves all rows in the pasted text to the same indent level, being that of the most indented line in the paste, instead of preserving the original heirarchy.

eg, when editing HAML:

```
|    %table
|      %tr
|        %td
|        %td
|  %table.reqs
```

if I copy and paste the tr and tds with all indent options off I get:

```
|    %table
|      %tr
|        %td
|        %td
|%tr
|  %td
|  %td
|  %table.reqs
```

And with auto indent on paste enabled I get:

```
|    %table
|      %tr
|        %td
|        %td
|        %tr
|        %td
|        %td
|        %table.reqs
```

Note that last line in the last example - that's actually pre-existing text after the paste that also gets pushed out to the new indent level :scream:

data.title: Documentation: On /packages, add link to most downloaded packages page
data.body:
I recently discovered that [there's a page which displays the most downloaded packages](https://atom.io/packages/list?direction=desc&page=1&sort=downloads). This page is very useful for me since **Featured** and **Trending** on [this page](https://atom.io/packages) only show top 6 packages.

But it wasn't obvious how to get to this page - I had to click "See All" next to "Newest" on [this page](https://atom.io/packages), then change sort settings.

Maybe you could add a link like this:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/992008/5138648/d0f61070-7106-11e4-8680-5a4db0c4fb3d.png)
- This could link to "most downloaded" or "most starred," I don't really mind either way
- This could be added next to **Trending** section instead of **Featured** section, I don't mind either way

data.title: protocol isn't getting to my opener on atom load
data.body:
I have this code to open http protocols in my package `web-browser`.  It runs in my activate method. ...

```
@opener = (filePath, options) =>
  if /^https?:\/\//.test filePath
    new Page @, filePath
atom.workspace.registerOpener @opener
```

I know this works properly because when I execute this code from a different package my opener catches it and everything works ...

```
atom.workspace.open url
```

However, if I start atom with the command `atom http://apple.com` then my opener never gets a chance to catch the url.  Instead atom opens up an empty editor tab with the url as the tab label.  The tree-view is empty.

I'm guessing that my package hasn't had a chance to register the opener yet.  My `activationEvents` in `package.json` is an empty array so I'm activating as fast as I can.

 This is a problem.  Any ideas on how I or the team can fix this?  If it is possible to fix I'd be happy to do a PR.

data.title: "Project Find" -> "Replace All" breaks encoding sometimes
data.body:
Example:
- clone https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin
- cmd + shift + f
- fill
  - 8333
  - 2222
  - *ru.ts
- hit "Replace All" and you'll get not only changes that you expected but also this (I did a cut from "git diff" to illustrate it better)

```
-        <translation>Промежуток от:</translation>
+        <translation>Промежуток ��т:</translation>

-        <translation>Не удалось записать информацию файла</translation>
+        <translation>Не удалось записать ин��ормацию файла</translation>
```

Atom 0.150.0
Mac OS 10.10

data.title: Atom command waits in windows command window
data.body:
I posted on this topic before but it seems to have disappeared from the issues list.  Are they sometimes totally deleted instead of closed?  I used `author:mark-hahn` as the filter and saw all postings I can remember.

Anyway, I have had a problem where the command window in windows doesn't return to the prompt when I start atom in the command line.  It just shows stdout with a prefix of `[5796:1120/164636:INFO:CONSOLE(72)]`.  This is the opposite problem noted in another issue where the `--wait` doesn't work.

This problem comes and goes but it just reappeared when I installed Atom 0.149.0 with the new windows squirrel installer.  It might be a coincidence of course.

Some sample output ...

```
C:\>atom
App load time: 176ms
[9036:1120/164633:INFO:renderer_main.cc(204)] Renderer process started
[5796:1120/164636:INFO:CONSOLE(64)] "Window load time: 2756ms", source: file:///C:/Users/Administrator/AppData/Local/atom/app-0.15
0.0/resources/app/static/index.js (64)
[5796:1120/164636:INFO:CONSOLE(72)] "RESPONDER:", source: C:\apps\autocomplete\js\ipc.js (72)
[5796:1120/164636:INFO:CONSOLE(72)] "RESPONDER:", source: C:\apps\autocomplete\js\ipc.js (72)
[5796:1120/164637:INFO:CONSOLE(72)] "RESPONDER:", source: C:\apps\autocomplete\js\ipc.js (72)
[5796:1120/164637:INFO:CONSOLE(72)] "RESPONDER:", source: C:\apps\autocomplete\js\ipc.js (72)
[5796:1120/164637:INFO:CONSOLE(72)] "RESPONDER:", source: C:\apps\autocomplete\js\ipc.js (72)
```
## Versions
- **Atom:**       0.150.0
- **Atom-Shell:** 0.19.2
- **OS:**         Microsoft Windows 8.1 Pro with Media Center
- **Misc**
  - apm  0.111.0
  - npm  1.4.4
  - node 0.10.33
  - python 2.7.8
  - git 1.7.11.msysgit.1
  - visual studio 2013

---

<small>This report was created in and posted from the Atom editor using the package `bug-report` version 0.4.1.</small>

data.title: Improper space behavior
data.body:
In a specific situation the space key puts a space in the buffer properly but the display doesn't update.  The reason I know the buffer is updated is because I discovered this in the middle of development of a package and was seeing the internal behavior.

The following is in safe mode ...

![Image inserted by Atom editor package auto-host-markdown-image](http://i.imgur.com/dzCrC6M.gif)
## Repro Steps
- Press `home` to get to right of indent space
- Press `backspace`
- Press `home` to get to beginning of line
- Press `space`

**Expected:** Cursor to move on space to right
**Actual:** Cursor doesn't move.

---
## Versions
- **Atom:**       0.150.0
- **Atom-Shell:** 0.19.2
- **OS:**         Microsoft Windows 8.1 Pro with Media Center
- **Misc**
  - apm  0.111.0
  - npm  1.4.4
  - node 0.10.33
  - python 2.7.8
  - git 1.7.11.msysgit.1
  - visual studio 2013

---

<small>This report was created in and posted from the Atom editor using the package `bug-report` version 0.4.1.</small>

data.title: Non-leading tab invisibles are not properly aligned to the indent guides
data.body:
Any tab invisibles that are not leading a line get bunched together instead of being evenly spaced. 

**Expected Behavior**
![screen shot 2014-11-20 at 17 32 45](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3586264/5135240/16d6088c-70dc-11e4-9435-5ca757428c54.png)
_Notice how each tab is spaced evenly on a 4-character grid_

**Observed Behavior**
![screen shot 2014-11-20 at 17 32 40](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3586264/5135243/1fdc99fa-70dc-11e4-88f5-dc27c0cf716c.png)
_The tabs are all bunched up at the beginning of the whitespace_

data.title: Problem with duplicate file names in modified files list
data.body: When you look at modified files through Command+Shift+B you may have modified multiple files with the same leaf filename. For example, in a rails project you may have lib/my_lib.rb and config/initializers/my_lib.rb. In this case only one of them shows up in the list of modified files, in my case it was the config one.

data.title: Unable to watch path
data.body:
I'm using ST3 but I'm following the evolution of Atom, and today I tried to test Atom again.

I opened a folder, and then I tried to open a file with Ctrl+P. The console is immediately shown and I can read : `Uncaught TypeError: Unable to watch path`.

YES, I tried `sudo sysctl fs.inotify.max_user_watches=32768` :)
Obviously it doesn't works. Should I put a greater value ? Yes, I restart Atom.

By the way, after a restart Atom shows a more detailed error:

```
TypeError: Unable to watch path
  at TypeError (native)
  at HandleWatcher.start (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/pathwatcher/lib/main.js:66:29)
  at new HandleWatcher (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/pathwatcher/lib/main.js:30:12)
  at new PathWatcher (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/pathwatcher/lib/main.js:120:30)
  at Object.exports.watch (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/pathwatcher/lib/main.js:179:12)
  at File.module.exports.File.subscribeToNativeChangeEvents (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/pathwatcher/lib/file.js:364:109)
  at File.module.exports.File.willAddSubscription (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/pathwatcher/lib/file.js:101:14)
  at File.willAddSubscription (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/pathwatcher/lib/file.js:3:61)
  at File.module.exports.File.onDidChange (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/pathwatcher/lib/file.js:85:12)
  at KeymapManager.module.exports.KeymapManager.watchKeymap (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/atom-keymap/lib/keymap-manager.js:288:74)
  at KeymapManager.module.exports.KeymapManager.loadKeymap (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/atom-keymap/lib/keymap-manager.js:273:16)
  at KeymapManager.loadUserKeymap (/opt/atom/resources/app/src/keymap-extensions.js:37:19)
  at Atom.module.exports.Atom.startEditorWindow (/opt/atom/resources/app/src/atom.js:564:20)
  at Object.<anonymous> (/opt/atom/resources/app/src/window-bootstrap.js:12:8)
  at Object.<anonymous> (/opt/atom/resources/app/src/window-bootstrap.js:23:4)
  at Module._compile (module.js:468:26)
  at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:486:10)
  at Module.load (/opt/atom/resources/app/node_modules/coffee-script/lib/coffee-script/register.js:45:36)
  at Function.Module._load (module.js:318:12)
  at Module.require (module.js:373:17)
  at require (module.js:392:17)
  at window.onload (file:///opt/atom/resources/app/static/index.js:41:25)
```

data.title: Rename atom.syntax to atom.grammars
data.body: Previously, `atom.syntax` was public but contained no public methods. I was considering removing it entirely when I noticed that we use `atom.syntax.selectGrammar` in some package specs, so I decided to make it officially public. The name `syntax` feels pretty vague now, and in the spirit of focusing our global objects on specific tasks, I think the name `grammars` blends in better with the rest of our global services.

data.title: Fix memory leaks introduced by changes for API freeze
data.body:
Some memory leaks have slipped through during the various contortions required for the API freeze:
- The updates to `GitRepository` subscriptions introduced a bug that caused to not unsubscribe correctly from `TextBuffer`s when they were destroyed.
- The jQuery shims weren't having `cleanData` called on them when the underlying custom element was removed, causing handlers which are held by global jQuery data structures to leak.

data.title: spell check markers not updated when font size change
data.body:
OS: Linux (Ubuntu 14.04 with XFCE)

Installed Atom from official Linux deb package.

Scenario
1. Open a file (with spell check support such as a `README.md`)
2. Look at spell check markers position
3. Open settings
4. Change font size
5. Go back to opened file tab

The spell check markers should follow the font size update but doesn't.

See screenshots below

![screenshot - 20112014 - 15 24 16](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/362710/5126007/c9a176d0-70c9-11e4-824d-2c8654053798.png)
![screenshot - 20112014 - 15 24 38](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/362710/5126006/c9a07d84-70c9-11e4-9ed0-3f59e38c6137.png)

data.title: `Shift` key breaks multikey bindings on Linux
data.body:
If you press `<shift>` during a multikey binding, the keybinding is unable to resolve.  To demonstrate, here are the results in Atom 0.147.0 on Ubuntu Linux 14.04 x86-64.

In dev tools, do:

```
atom.keymaps.add("test", {"body": {"o P": "core:confirm" }})
```

Keybinding resolver output:

`o`:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/333673/5119915/be6c93ca-703e-11e4-8f79-0e109e0c4dc8.png)

`o<shift-down>`:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/333673/5119922/e4f022dc-703e-11e4-9d51-075f5dcf92c5.png)

`o<shift-down>p`:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/333673/5119935/212d72d6-703f-11e4-940d-d5c7e3b07a37.png)

Also tried another keybinding `O P`:

This works. `<shift-down>op<shift-up>`:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/333673/5119963/70ea2b3e-703f-11e4-816e-cf18259332fe.png)

However, if I released shift and pressed it again, then once again, the keybinding would fail to resolve. When I tested a third keybinding, `O p`, I found that it always succeeded, unless I pressed shift at some point before typing `p`.

This seems to indicate that the `<shift-down>` event is breaking multikey bindings.

See also atom/vim-mode#442

data.title: Merge pull request #1 from atom/master
data.body: Updating atom repo

data.title: White bar when auto hiding menu
data.body: This isn't really a bug just a visual thing.  When the menu auto-hides on windows you see a white bar appear at the bottom due to the window resizing.  It only stays there for a small amount of time until the window had resized but it introduces a flicker to the window.  There is also a small flicker in the window when the menu appears but not as obvious as when it hides.  It would be nice if it didn't do this.

data.title: Can't select auto-completions with tab when shadow DOM is enabled
Replace jQuery-based tooltip API with atom.tooltips global
data.body: It still uses Bootstrap underneath the hood to save us the trouble of implementing tooltips, but the new API works with raw DOM nodes and does not require any access to jQuery. Since we're no longer exporting the version of jQuery that has the tooltip API, this is the only way to provide the tooltip facility now.

Atom 0.148.0

data.title: atom doesn't start from everywhere
data.body:
I can't start atom from /home/myName (debian).
Atom give the error :

A JavaScript error occured in the browser process

```
Uncaught Exception:
TypeError: Arguments to path.join must be strings
   at Object.exports.join (path.js:384:15)
   at new AtomProtocolHandler (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/src/browser/atom-protocol-handler.js:20:32)
   at new AtomApplication (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/src/browser/atom-application.js:87:34)
   at createAtomApplication (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/src/browser/atom-application.js:43:16)
   at Function.module.exports.AtomApplication.open (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/src/browser/atom-application.js:46:9)
   at EventEmitter.<anonymous> (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/src/browser/main.js:70:23)
   at EventEmitter.emit (events.js:129:20)

```

It's curious because I can do it if I already have another instance running (started from another directory).

System : 3.2.0-4-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 3.2.63-2+deb7u1 x86_64 GNU/Linux
More info : 
https://discuss.atom.io/t/atom-doesnt-start-everywhere/13340
